description: Detects the creation of files with an "LNK" as a second extension. This is sometimes used by malware as a method to abuse the fact that Windows hides the "LNK" extension by default.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
frack113
false_positives: Some tuning is required for other general purpose directories of third party apps
name: Suspicious LNK Double Extension File
query: (((file.path.text:"*.lnk" AND file.path.text:("*.doc.*" OR "*.docx.*" OR "*.jpg.*" OR "*.pdf.*" OR "*.ppt.*" OR "*.pptx.*" OR "*.xls.*" OR "*.xlsx.*")) AND (NOT file.path.text:"*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Recent\\*")) AND (NOT (((process.executable.text:("*\\excel.exe" OR "*\\powerpnt.exe" OR "*\\winword.exe") AND file.path.text:"*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\Office\\Recent\\*")) OR ((process.executable.text:"*\\excel.exe" AND file.path.text:"*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\Excel*")) OR ((process.executable.text:"*\\powerpnt.exe" AND file.path.text:"*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\PowerPoint*")) OR ((process.executable.text:"*\\winword.exe" AND file.path.text:"*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\Word*")))))
